member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySchedule
member.summary: The class represents the weekly schedule for an Active Directory Domain Services replication.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySchedule.#ctor(System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySchedule)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, using the specified object.
member.param: A object that is copied to this object.
member.exception: is .

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySchedule.RawSchedule
member.summary: Gets or sets a three-dimensional array that indicates at what time during the week that the source is available for replication.
member.returns:
A three-dimensional array of elements in which the element is if the source is available for replication during that specific 15-minute interval. The element is if the source is not available for replication. The array is in the form RawSchedule[<day-of-week>, <hour>, <15-minute interval>]. All of these values are zero-based and the week begins at 00:00 on Sunday morning, Coordinated Universal Time. The following are the valid values for the day-of-week. Day-of-week value
Indicated day of the week.
0
Sunday
1
Monday
2
Tuesday
3
Wednesday
4
Thursday
5
Friday
6
Saturday
The hour is zero-based and specified in 24-hour format. For example, 2 P.M. would be specified as 14. Valid values are 0-23. The 15-minute interval specifies the 15-minute block within the hour that the source is available for replication. The following table identifies the possible values for the 15-minute interval. 15-minute interval
Description
0
The source is available for replication from 0 to 14 minutes after the hour.
1
The source is available for replication from 15 to 29 minutes after the hour.
2
The source is available for replication from 30 to 44 minutes after the hour.
3
The source is available for replication from 45 to 59 minutes after the hour.
The following C# example shows how to use this property to determine if the source is available for replication at 15:50 Coordinated Universal Time on Tuesday. Boolean isAvailable = scheduleObject.RawSchedule[2, 15, 3];
The following C# example shows how to use this property to calculate the 15-minute interval at runtime by dividing the minutes by 15. Boolean isAvailable = scheduleObject.RawSchedule[2, 15, (Int32)50/15];

member.name: M:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySchedule.ResetSchedule
member.summary: Resets the entire schedule to unavailable.

member.summary: Adds a range of times for every day of the week to the schedule.
member.param: One of the members that specifies the first hour that the source will be available for replication.
One of the members that specifies the first 15-minute interval that the source will be available for replication.
One of the members that specifies the final hour that the source will be available for replication.
One of the members that specifies the final 15-minute interval that the source will be available for replication.

member.summary: Adds a range of times for a single day to the schedule.

One of the members that specifies the final 15-minute interval that the source will be available for replication.
member.exception: The start time is after the end time.
One or more parameters is not valid.
is .

member.summary: The class contains information about a replication neighbor of an or object.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.ConsecutiveFailureCount
member.summary: Gets the number of replication failures since the last successful replication cycle.
member.returns: The number of failed replication attempts from this source since the last successful replication attempt. If no previous attempt was successful, the return value is the number of failed replication attempts since the source was added as a neighbor.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.LastAttemptedSync
member.summary: Gets the time of the last replication attempt from this source.
member.returns: The time of the last replication attempt. If no replication attempt occurred, the value is zero.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.LastSuccessfulSync
member.summary: Gets the time of the last successful replication cycle from this source.
member.returns: The time of the last successful synchronization. If no replication succeeded, the value is zero.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.LastSyncMessage
member.summary: Gets the message that is associated with the last replication attempt from this source.
member.returns: The message that corresponds to the last replication attempt. If the last attempt succeeded, the value is an empty string.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.LastSyncResult
member.summary: Gets the error code that is associated with the last replication attempt from this source.
member.returns: The error code for the last replication attempt. If the last attempt succeeded, the value is ERROR_SUCCESS.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.PartitionName
member.summary: Gets the partition name for this object.
member.returns: The name of the partition for this object.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.ReplicationNeighborOption
member.summary: Gets the attribute and object settings for this object.
member.returns: A value that contains the attribute and option settings for this object.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.ReplicationNeighborOptions
member.summary: Specifies the options for a object.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.ReplicationNeighborOptions.CompressChanges
member.summary: Changes that are received from this source are compressed. This option is usually set only if the source server is in a different site.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.ReplicationNeighborOptions.DisableScheduledSync
member.summary: This option is set to disable synchronizations based on its schedule. The only way this neighbor will perform synchronizations is in response to a change notification or to a manual request for synchronizations.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.ReplicationNeighborOptions.FullSyncInProgress
member.summary: The destination server is performing a full synchronization from the source server. Full synchronizations do not use vectors that create updates (DS_REPL_CURSORS) for filtering updates. Full synchronizations are not used as a part of the normal replication protocol.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.ReplicationNeighborOptions.FullSyncNextPacket
member.summary: The last packet from the source indicated that an object that has not yet been created by the destination server has been modified. The next packet that is requested will instruct the source server to put all attributes of the modified object into the packet.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.ReplicationNeighborOptions.IgnoreChangeNotifications
member.summary: This option is set to disable notification based synchronizations. Within a site, domain controllers synchronize with each other based on notifications when changes occur. This setting prevents this neighbor from performing syncs that are triggered by notifications. The neighbor will still do synchronizations based on its schedule, or if requested manually.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.ReplicationNeighborOptions.NeverSynced
member.summary: A synchronization has never been successfully completed from this source.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.ReplicationNeighborOptions.NoChangeNotifications
member.summary: No change notifications should be received from this source. This option is usually set only if the source server is in a different site.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.ReplicationNeighborOptions.PartialAttributeSet
member.summary: This neighbor is in a state where it is rebuilding the contents of this replica because of a change in the partial attribute set.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.ReplicationNeighborOptions.Preempted
member.summary: The replication engine has temporarily stopped processing this neighbor in order to service another higher-priority neighbor, either for this partition or another partition. The replication engine will resume processing this neighbor after the higher-priority work is completed.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.ReplicationNeighborOptions.ReturnObjectParent
member.summary: This neighbor is in a state where it returns parent objects before children objects. It goes into this state after it receives a child object before its parent.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.ReplicationNeighborOptions.ScheduledSync
member.summary: Perform replication on a schedule. This option is normally set unless the schedule for this naming context/source is "never", that is, the empty schedule.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.ReplicationNeighborOptions.SyncOnStartup
member.summary: Replication of this naming context from this source is attempted when the destination server is restarted. This normally only applies to intra-site neighbors.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.ReplicationNeighborOptions.TwoWaySync
member.summary: If set, this option indicates that when inbound replication is complete, the destination server must tell the source server to synchronize in the reverse direction. This feature is used in dial-up scenarios where only one of the two servers can initiate a dial-up connection. For example, this option would be used in a corporate headquarters and branch office, where the branch office connects to the corporate headquarters over the Internet by means of a dial-up ISP connection.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.ReplicationNeighborOptions.UseInterSiteTransport
member.summary: Perform replication indirectly through the Inter-Site Messaging Service. This flag is set only when replicating over SMTP. This flag is not set when replicating over inter-site RPC/IP.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.ReplicationNeighborOptions.Writeable
member.summary: The local copy of the naming context is writable.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.SourceInvocationId
member.summary: Gets the invocation identifier that was used by the replication source server in the last replication attempt.
member.returns: The invocation identifier that was used by the replication source server in the last replication attempt.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.SourceServer
member.summary: Gets the name of the replication source server.
member.returns: The name of the replication source server.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.TransportType
member.summary: Gets the transport type that was used for replication.
member.returns: A enumeration value that indicates the transport type that was used for the replication connection.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationNeighbor.UsnAttributeFilter
member.summary: Gets the update sequence number (USN) value for the last successful replication cycle.
member.returns: The USN value for the last successful replication cycle. If no replication succeeded, the value is zero.

member.summary: Gets the update sequence number (USN) of the last object update that was received.
member.returns: The USN of the last update that was received.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationSecurityLevel
member.summary: Specifies the Active Directory Lightweight Directory (AD LDS) Services replication authentication mode.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationSecurityLevel.MutualAuthentication
member.summary: Kerberos authentication, using service principal names (SPNs), required. If Kerberos authentication fails, the AD LDS instances will not replicate.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationSecurityLevel.Negotiate
member.summary: Kerberos authentication (using SPNs) is attempted first. If Kerberos fails, NTLM authentication is attempted. If NTLM fails, the AD LDS instances will not replicate.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReplicationSecurityLevel.NegotiatePassThrough
member.summary: All AD LDS instances in the configuration set use an identical account name and password as the AD LDS service account.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.SyncFromAllServersOptions
member.summary: Specifies additional options when performing a synchronization.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.SyncFromAllServersOptions.AbortIfServerUnavailable
member.summary: Aborts the synchronization if any server cannot be contacted or if any server is unreachable.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.SyncFromAllServersOptions.CheckServerAlivenessOnly
member.summary: Disables all synchronization. The topology is analyzed and unavailable or unreachable servers are identified.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.SyncFromAllServersOptions.CrossSite
member.summary: Synchronizes across site boundaries. By default, this method attempts to synchronize only with domain controllers in the same site as the home system. Set this flag to attempt to synchronize with all domain controllers in the enterprise forest. However, the domain controllers can be synchronized only if connected by a synchronous (RPC) transport.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.SyncFromAllServersOptions.None
member.summary: No synchronization options.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.SyncFromAllServersOptions.PushChangeOutward
member.summary: Pushes changes from the home server out to all partners using transitive replication. This reverses the direction of replication and the order of execution of the replication sets from the usual mode of execution.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.SyncFromAllServersOptions.SkipInitialCheck
member.summary: Assumes that all servers are responding. This will speed up the operation of this method, but if some servers are not responding, some transitive replications might be blocked.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.SyncFromAllServersOptions.SyncAdjacentServerOnly
member.summary: Disables transitive replication. Synchronization is performed only with adjacent servers.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.SyncUpdateCallback
member.summary: Receives event notifications during a replica synchronization.
member.param: One of the members that specifies the type of event.
Contains the DNS name of the server that is the target of the replication. This parameter will be if it is not used by the notification.
Contains the DNS name of the server that is the source of the replication. This parameter will be if it is not used by the notification.
A object that contains additional information about any error that has occurred. This parameter will be if no error has occurred.
member.returns: if the SyncReplicaFromAllServers method invoked on a , or object should resume; if the SyncReplicaFromAllServers method should terminate.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.TrustDirection.Inbound

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights
member.summary: The enumeration specifies the access rights that are assigned to an Active Directory Domain Services object.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights.AccessSystemSecurity
member.summary: The right to get or set the SACL in the object security descriptor.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights.CreateChild
member.summary: The right to create children of the object.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights.Delete
member.summary: The right to delete the object.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights.DeleteChild
member.summary: The right to delete children of the object.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights.DeleteTree
member.summary: The right to delete all children of this object, regardless of the permissions of the children.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights.ExtendedRight
member.summary: A customized control access right. For a list of possible extended rights, see the topic "Extended Rights" in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com. For more information about extended rights, see the topic "Control Access Rights" in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights.GenericAll
member.summary: The right to create or delete children, delete a subtree, read and write properties, examine children and the object itself, add and remove the object from the directory, and read or write with an extended right.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights.GenericExecute
member.summary: The right to read permissions on, and list the contents of, a container object.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights.GenericRead
member.summary: The right to read permissions on this object, read all the properties on this object, list this object name when the parent container is listed, and list the contents of this object if it is a container.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights.GenericWrite
member.summary: The right to read permissions on this object, write all the properties on this object, and perform all validated writes to this object.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights.ListChildren
member.summary: The right to list children of this object. For more information about this right, see the topic "Controlling Object Visibility" in the MSDN Library http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights.ListObject
member.summary: The right to list a particular object. For more information about this right, see the topic "Controlling Object Visibility" in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights.ReadControl
member.summary: The right to read data from the security descriptor of the object, not including the data in the SACL.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights.ReadProperty
member.summary: The right to read properties of the object.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights.Self
member.summary: The right to perform an operation that is controlled by a validated write access right.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights.Synchronize
member.summary: The right to use the object for synchronization. This right enables a thread to wait until that object is in the signaled state.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights.WriteDacl
member.summary: The right to modify the DACL in the object security descriptor.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights.WriteOwner
member.summary: The right to assume ownership of the object. The user must be an object trustee. The user cannot transfer the ownership to other users.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights.WriteProperty
member.summary: The right to write properties of the object.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance
member.summary: The enumeration specifies if, and how, ACE information is applied to an object and its descendents.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance.All
member.summary: Indicates inheritance that includes the object to which the ACE is applied, the object's immediate children, and the descendents of the object's children.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance.Children
member.summary: Indicates inheritance that includes the object's immediate children only, not the object itself or the descendents of its children.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance.Descendents
member.summary: Indicates inheritance that includes the object's immediate children and the descendants of the object's children, but not the object itself.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance.None
member.summary: Indicates no inheritance. The ACE information is only used on the object on which the ACE is set. ACE information is not inherited by any descendents of the object.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance.SelfAndChildren
member.summary: Indicates inheritance that includes the object itself and its immediate children. It does not include the descendents of its children.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes
member.summary: The enumeration specifies the types of authentication used in . This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.Anonymous
member.summary: No authentication is performed.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.Delegation
member.summary: Enables Active Directory Services Interface (ADSI) to delegate the user's security context, which is necessary for moving objects across domains.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.Encryption
member.summary: Attaches a cryptographic signature to the message that both identifies the sender and ensures that the message has not been modified in transit.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.FastBind
member.summary: Specifies that ADSI will not attempt to query the Active Directory Domain Services objectClass property. Therefore, only the base interfaces that are supported by all ADSI objects will be exposed. Other interfaces that the object supports will not be available. A user can use this option to boost the performance in a series of object manipulations that involve only methods of the base interfaces. However, ADSI does not verify if any of the request objects actually exist on the server. For more information, see the topic "Fast Binding Option for Batch Write/Modify Operations" in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library. For more information about the objectClass property, see the "Object-Class" topic in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.None
member.summary: Equates to zero, which means to use basic authentication (simple bind) in the LDAP provider.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.ReadonlyServer
member.summary: For a WinNT provider, ADSI tries to connect to a domain controller. For Active Directory Domain Services, this flag indicates that a writable server is not required for a serverless binding.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.Sealing
member.summary: Encrypts data using Kerberos. The flag must also be set to use sealing.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.Secure
member.summary: Requests secure authentication. When this flag is set, the WinNT provider uses NTLM to authenticate the client. Active Directory Domain Services uses Kerberos, and possibly NTLM, to authenticate the client. When the user name and password are a null reference ( in Visual Basic), ADSI binds to the object using the security context of the calling thread, which is either the security context of the user account under which the application is running or of the client user account that the calling thread is impersonating.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.SecureSocketsLayer
member.summary: Attaches a cryptographic signature to the message that both identifies the sender and ensures that the message has not been modified in transit. Active Directory Domain Services requires the Certificate Server be installed to support Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) encryption.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.ServerBind
member.summary: If your ADsPath includes a server name, specify this flag when using the LDAP provider. Do not use this flag for paths that include a domain name or for serverless paths. Specifying a server name without also specifying this flag results in unnecessary network traffic.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.Signing
member.summary: Verifies data integrity to ensure that the data received is the same as the data sent. The flag must also be set to use signing.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.CreateChildAccessRule
member.summary: The class represents a specific type of access rule that is used to allow or deny an Active Directory Domain Services object the right to create child objects.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the scope of the search that is observed by the server.
member.returns: One of the values. The default is .
member.exception: The value is not one of the values.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.SecurityMasks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating which security access information for the specified attributes should be returned by the search.
member.returns: One of the values.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.ServerPageTimeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the maximum amount of time the server should search for an individual page of results. This is not the same as the time limit for the entire search.
member.returns: A that represents the amount of time the server should search for a page of results. The default value is -1 seconds, which means to search indefinitely.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.ServerTimeLimit
member.summary: The property gets or sets a value indicating the maximum amount of time the server spends searching. If the time limit is reached, only entries that are found up to that point are returned.
member.returns: A that represents the amount of time that the server should search. The default value is -1 seconds, which means to use the server-determined default of 120 seconds.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.SizeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the maximum number of objects that the server returns in a search.
member.returns: The maximum number of objects that the server returns in a search. The default value is zero, which means to use the server-determined default size limit of 1000 entries.
member.exception: The new value is less than zero.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.Sort
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the property on which the results are sorted.
member.returns: A object that specifies the property and direction that the search results should be sorted on.
member.exception: The property value is (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.Tombstone
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the search should also return deleted objects that match the search filter.
member.returns: if deleted objects should be included in the search; otherwise. The default value is .

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.VirtualListView
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the virtual list view options for the search.
member.returns: A object that contains the virtual list view search information. The default value for this property is , which means do not use the virtual list view search option.

member.summary: No flags are set.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySynchronizationOptions.ObjectSecurity
member.summary: If this flag is not present, the caller must have the right to replicate changes. If this flag is present, the caller requires no rights, but is allowed to see only objects and attributes that are accessible to the caller.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySynchronizationOptions.ParentsFirst
member.summary: Return parents before children, when parents would otherwise appear later in the replication stream.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySynchronizationOptions.PublicDataOnly
member.summary: Do not return private data in the search results.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.ExtendedRightAccessRule
member.summary: Represents a specific type of access rule that is used to allow or deny an Active Directory object an extended right. Extended rights are special operations that are not covered by the standard set of access rights. An example of an extended right is Send-As, which gives a user the right to send email for another user. For a list of possible extended rights, see the Extended Rights article. For more information about extended rights, see the Control Access Rights.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.ReferralChasingOption
member.summary: The enumeration specifies if and how referral chasing is pursued.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ReferralChasingOption.All
member.summary: Chase referrals of either the subordinate or external type.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ReferralChasingOption.External
member.summary: Chase external referrals. If no referral chasing option is specified for a directory search, the type of referral chasing performed is .

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ReferralChasingOption.None
member.summary: Never chase the referred-to server. Setting this option prevents a client from contacting other servers in a referral process.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ReferralChasingOption.Subordinate
member.summary: Chase only subordinate referrals that are a subordinate naming context in a directory tree. The ADSI LDAP provider always turns off this flag for paged searches.

member.summary: Limits the search to the base object. The result contains a maximum of one object. When the property is specified for a search, the scope of the search must be set to .

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.SearchScope.OneLevel
member.summary: Searches the immediate child objects of the base object, excluding the base object.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.SearchScope.Subtree
member.summary: Searches the whole subtree, including the base object and all its child objects. If the scope of a directory search is not specified, a type of search is performed.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.SecurityMasks
member.summary: Specifies the available options for examining security information of a directory object. This enumeration is used with the and properties.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.SecurityMasks.Dacl
member.summary: Reads or writes the discretionary access-control list (DACL) data.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.SecurityMasks.Group
member.summary: Reads or writes the group data.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.SecurityMasks.None
member.summary: Does not read or write security data.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.SecurityMasks.Owner
member.summary: Reads or writes the owner data.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.SecurityMasks.Sacl
member.summary: Reads or writes the system access-control list (SACL) data.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.SortDirection
member.summary: The enumeration specifies how to sort the results of an Active Directory Domain Services query.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.SortDirection.Ascending
member.summary: Sort from smallest to largest. For example, A to Z.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.SortDirection.Descending
member.summary: Sort from largest to smallest. For example, Z to A.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.SortOption
member.summary: Specifies how to sort the results of a search.

member.name: M:System.DirectoryServices.SortOption.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.DirectoryServices.SortOption.#ctor(System.String,System.DirectoryServices.SortDirection)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, which contains the specified property name and specified sort direction.
member.param: The name of the property to sort by. The property is set to this value.
One of the values. The property is set to this value.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.SortOption.Direction
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction in which to sort the results of a query.
member.returns: One of the values. The default is Ascending.
member.exception: The value is not one of the values.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.SortOption.PropertyName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the property to sort on.
member.returns: The name of the property to sort on. The default is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
member.exception: The property value is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
